attributes.comment:
I don't understand the fee increase for N-600 Application for Certificate of
Citizenship from $255 to $460, at least when it comes to foreign adopted children.

When the child is brought into the country, the USCIS is *at that time of entry*
given all the documentation necessary to establish that the foreign adoption
took place. The USCIS would not have allowed the child into the country if it
had not already been given the necessary information and made the determination
that the adoptive relationship is valid. And under the Citizenship Act of 2000,
the foreign adopted child is automatically a citizen upon arrival and legal entry.

Therefore, I do not understand why more than a nominal paperwork fee is needed,
and I certainly do not understand the large increase in the fee that is proposed.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Greg Holmes
